result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberly M Barkley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution is ordered in the amount of $67.96.  Cash bail applied - PAID IN FULL.
Cash bail applied to costs - PAID IN FULL.  DNA surcharge is waived.

Huber with standard release conditions.
Consecutive to: Case 14CM689.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence ON CASE 15CF612.

Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Kimberly M Barkley in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Joseph Smith.   
Case called along with:  15CF612
Defendant did not successfully complete Drug Treatment Court.
Based on the non-complaince with DTC - Defendant's DPA was revoked.

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.


Court orders the following:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Consecutive to:  14CM689

RESTITUTION:  $67.96 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision to Roundys).
COURT COSTS:  $268
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and SURCHARGE:  Court Waives.

Apply Bail to this Case then to Case 15CF612 and any balance can be refunded to the posting party.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given. 

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  
Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence ON CASE 15CF612.
